title: Establishing the White House Task Force on the FIFA World Cup 2026

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a White House Task Force to coordinate the U.S. government's preparation and planning for the FIFA World Cup 2026, which the United States will co-host. The task force is chaired by the President and includes key Cabinet members and senior officials, and is charged with ensuring effective government support to promote economic growth, tourism, and national pride around the event.
potential_concerns: The coordination across many federal agencies may lead to bureaucratic delays or overlapping responsibilities.
Funding and resources dependent on appropriations could limit effectiveness or delay important preparations.
The large-scale event may pose security risks that require careful management to avoid incidents.
There could be insufficient communication with local and state governments or private sector stakeholders involved in the event.
The task forceâ€™s termination date could be prematurely set, not allowing sufficient time for post-event evaluations or legacy planning.
